revised_title: Exploring the Glass-Drop Phenomenon and the Tempering of Glass
tldr: The author investigates the phenomenon of the Lacrymae Batavica, or Glass-Drops, and their similarities to tempered steel. They discover that the glass drops acquire their unique properties when red-hot glass is plunged into cold water, causing the particles to be separated by a large amount of fiery particles. The author explains that the annealing process, which involves heating the glass to a moderate temperature, keeps the pores open and prevents the glass from breaking. This understanding can be applied to other fused substances as well.
